Description: Terracotta cone, local coarse clay with much chaff, on outside of cone, incised slightly diagonal lines radiating down towards base with triangles sitting on top of them.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked in pencil on underside "175". The findspot of the piece is uncertain as it was not on the list of objects sent by the EEF.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TH.34)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6067 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
